channel.title: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture
channel.description: The Central Art Aboriginal Art and Culture section is a collection of articles, audios and videos relating to Australian Aboriginal people and their art. Here you will find stories on Aboriginal dreamings, interviews with Aboriginal artists and information on the different Aboriginal art regions.
channel.itunes:author: info@aboriginalartstore.com.au
channel.itunes:subtitle: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture
channel.itunes:summary: The Central Art Aboriginal Art and Culture section is a collection of articles, audios and videos relating to Australian Aboriginal people and their art. Here you will find stories on Aboriginal dreamings, interviews with Aboriginal artists and information on the different Aboriginal art regions.

itunes:owner.itunes:name: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture

item.title: Interview with Vincent Forrester (Two Boys)
item.description: Aboriginal Artist Vincent Forrester tells the story details of his painting Two Boys (Ulay Kutitja) Dreaming in an interview with Sabine Haider,Central Art- Aboriginal Art Store.
item.itunes:author: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Vincent Forrester (Two Boys)
item.itunes:summary: Aboriginal Artist Vincent Forrester tells the story details of his painting Two Boys (Ulay Kutitja) Dreaming in an interview with Sabine Haider,Central Art- Aboriginal Art Store.
item.itunes:keywords: aboriginal, art, aboriginal art, visual arts, aboriginal culture, australian aboriginal

item.title: Interview with Vincent Forrester (Uluru 3)
item.description: Aboriginal Artist Vincent Forrester discusses the significance of his third painting in the three part series representing 'Imanpa and Wilbia, two little boys in wind shelter.'
item.itunes:author: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Vincent Forrester (Uluru 3)
item.itunes:summary: Aboriginal Artist Vincent Forrester discusses the significance of his third painting in the three part series representing 'Imanpa and Wilbia, two little boys in wind shelter.'
item.itunes:keywords: aboriginal, art, aboriginal art, visual arts, aboriginal culture, australian aboriginal

item.title: Interview with Vincent Forrester (Uluru 2)
item.description: Aboriginal Artist Vincent Forrester discusses the significance of his second painting in the three part series representing 'Imampa, Wilbia, Atilla, Uluru and Kata Juta or Lake Wickita in wind shelter'.
item.itunes:author: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Vincent Forrester (Uluru 2)
item.itunes:summary: Aboriginal Artist Vincent Forrester discusses the significance of his second painting in the three part series representing 'Imampa, Wilbia, Atilla, Uluru and Kata Juta or Lake Wickita in wind shelter'.
item.itunes:keywords: aboriginal, art, aboriginal art, visual arts, aboriginal culture, australian aboriginal

item.title: Interview with Vincent Forrester (Uluru 1)
item.description: Aboriginal Artist Vincent Forrester describes the significance of his first painting in the three part series representing 'Atilla, Uluru and Kati Juta.'
item.itunes:author: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Vincent Forrester (Uluru 1)
item.itunes:summary: Aboriginal Artist Vincent Forrester describes the significance of his first painting in the three part series representing 'Atilla, Uluru and Kati Juta.'
item.itunes:keywords: aboriginal, art, aboriginal art, visual arts, aboriginal culture, australian aboriginal

item.title: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (Warlpiri 2)
item.description: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Maloney Jagamara discusses his identity and culture as part of the Warlpiri people of desert Australia. He describes the Warlpiri as the keepers of fire, water and 'all the blood that flows to the rest of Australia.'
item.itunes:author: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (Warlpiri 2)
item.itunes:summary: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Maloney Jagamara discusses his identity and culture as part of the Warlpiri people of desert Australia. He describes the Warlpiri as the keepers of fire, water and 'all the blood that flows to the rest of Australia.'
item.itunes:keywords: aboriginal, art, aboriginal art, visual arts, aboriginal culture, australian aboriginal

item.title: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (My First Painting)
item.description: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Maloney Jagamara tells the story of painting and selling his first artwork in Alice Springs for a bus ticket and a feed.
item.itunes:author: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (My First Painting)
item.itunes:summary: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Maloney Jagamara tells the story of painting and selling his first artwork in Alice Springs for a bus ticket and a feed.
item.itunes:keywords: aboriginal, art, aboriginal art, visual arts, aboriginal culture, australian aboriginal

item.title: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (Coming Home)
item.description: As one of the stolen generation, Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Maloney Jagamara talks about driving to Willowra and meeting his Warlpiri family for the first time in 1975.
item.itunes:author: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (Coming Home)
item.itunes:summary: As one of the stolen generation, Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Maloney Jagamara talks about driving to Willowra and meeting his Warlpiri family for the first time in 1975.
item.itunes:keywords: aboriginal, art, aboriginal art, visual arts, aboriginal culture, australian aboriginal

item.title: Interview withMalcolm Jagamara (Water Dreaming)
item.description: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Maloney Jagamara talks about inheriting the Water Dreaming in 1998 and the special ceremonies that followed.
item.itunes:author: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview withMalcolm Jagamara (Water Dreaming)
item.itunes:summary: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Maloney Jagamara talks about inheriting the Water Dreaming in 1998 and the special ceremonies that followed.
item.itunes:keywords: aboriginal, art, aboriginal art, visual arts, aboriginal culture, australian aboriginal

item.title: Interview with Malcolm Jagamarra (Clifford Possum)
item.description: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Jagamarra talks to Sabine about the late Clifford Possum, his hero and a man that inspired him and his art immensely.
item.itunes:author: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Malcolm Jagamarra (Clifford Possum)
item.itunes:summary: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Jagamarra talks to Sabine about the late Clifford Possum, his hero and a man that inspired him and his art immensely.
item.itunes:keywords: aboriginal, art, aboriginal art, visual arts, aboriginal culture, australian aboriginal

item.title: Interview with Malcolm Jagamarra (Claypans Painting)
item.description: Malcolm Jagamarra talks to Sabine about the Claypans Painting, an original and important piece by Malcolm as it involves combining both his dreaming with the Claypans Story for the first time.
item.itunes:author: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Malcolm Jagamarra (Claypans Painting)
item.itunes:summary: Malcolm Jagamarra talks to Sabine about the Claypans Painting, an original and important piece by Malcolm as it involves combining both his dreaming with the Claypans Story for the first time.
item.itunes:keywords: aboriginal, art, aboriginal art, visual arts, aboriginal culture, australian aboriginal

item.title: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (Budgerigar Dreaming)
item.description: Aboriginal artist Malcolm Jagamarra talks to Sabine about his painting Budgerigar Dreaming and his relationship with this dreaming as a descendent of the budgerigar ancesotors.
item.itunes:author: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (Budgerigar Dreaming)
item.itunes:summary: Aboriginal artist Malcolm Jagamarra talks to Sabine about his painting Budgerigar Dreaming and his relationship with this dreaming as a descendent of the budgerigar ancesotors.
item.itunes:keywords: aboriginal, art, aboriginal art, visual arts, aboriginal culture, australian aboriginal

item.title: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (Inapaku Dreaming)
item.description: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Maloney Jagamara talks about the significance of Inapaku or Lake Suprise, the fresh water lake in the middle of the Australian Tanami desert.
item.itunes:author: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (Inapaku Dreaming)
item.itunes:summary: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Maloney Jagamara talks about the significance of Inapaku or Lake Suprise, the fresh water lake in the middle of the Australian Tanami desert.
item.itunes:keywords: aboriginal, art, aboriginal art, visual arts, aboriginal culture, australian aboriginal

item.title: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (Warlpiri People)
item.description: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Maloney Jagamara discusses his identity and culture as part of the Warlpiri people of desert Australia. He discusses the four Warlpiri subsections.
item.itunes:author: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (Warlpiri People)
item.itunes:summary: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Maloney Jagamara discusses his identity and culture as part of the Warlpiri people of desert Australia. He discusses the four Warlpiri subsections.
item.itunes:keywords: aboriginal, art, aboriginal art, visual arts, aboriginal culture, australian aboriginal

item.title: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (Willowra)
item.description: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Maloney Jagamara talks about putting on the first cinematic experience for his family at the Aboriginal community of Willowra.
item.itunes:author: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (Willowra)
item.itunes:summary: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Maloney Jagamara talks about putting on the first cinematic experience for his family at the Aboriginal community of Willowra.
item.itunes:keywords: aboriginal, art, aboriginal art, visual arts, aboriginal culture, australian aboriginal

item.title: Interview with Malcolm Jagamarra (Billy Stockman)
item.description: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Jagamarra talks to Sabine about his relationship with Billy Stockman Japaltjarri, one of the original stockmen, founders of the Papunya community and renonwned artist of the Central Desert.
item.itunes:author: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Malcolm Jagamarra (Billy Stockman)
item.itunes:summary: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Jagamarra talks to Sabine about his relationship with Billy Stockman Japaltjarri, one of the original stockmen, founders of the Papunya community and renonwned artist of the Central Desert.
item.itunes:keywords: aboriginal, art, aboriginal art, visual arts, aboriginal culture, australian aboriginal

item.title: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (Farewell to Mum)
item.description: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Maloney Jagamaratalks about his painting 'Farewell to Mum' which symbolises a collection of stories passed down to him from his mother.
item.itunes:author: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (Farewell to Mum)
item.itunes:summary: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Maloney Jagamaratalks about his painting 'Farewell to Mum' which symbolises a collection of stories passed down to him from his mother.
item.itunes:keywords: aboriginal, art, aboriginal art, visual arts, aboriginal culture, australian aboriginal

item.title: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (Early School)
item.description: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Maloney Jagamara talks about the positive impact that going to school had on him in Adelaide as a young Walpiri teenager and sends a message to the young Warlpiri generation from desert Australia today.
item.itunes:author: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (Early School)
item.itunes:summary: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Maloney Jagamara talks about the positive impact that going to school had on him in Adelaide as a young Walpiri teenager and sends a message to the young Warlpiri generation from desert Australia today.
item.itunes:keywords: aboriginal, art, aboriginal art, visual arts, aboriginal culture, australian aboriginal

item.title: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (Lander River)
item.description: Malcolm Jagamarra talks to Sabine about the Lander River 2006 Painting and the importance of the Lander River to his art and dreaming.
item.itunes:author: Aboriginal Art Store Art History & Culture
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (Lander River)
item.itunes:summary: Malcolm Jagamarra talks to Sabine about the Lander River 2006 Painting and the importance of the Lander River to his art and dreaming.
item.itunes:keywords: aboriginal, art, aboriginal art, visual arts, aboriginal culture, australian aboriginal

item.title: Interview with Malcolm Jagamara (Mentors)
item.description: Aboriginal Artist Malcolm Jagamara talks about his beginnings as a painter and his early art mentors.
